results.title: They served their country
results.creator_credit: Audio-Visual Aids, University of Melbourne and Returned Sailors, Soldiers and Airmens Imperial League of Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the efforts made by the RSL to keep alive the spirit of comradeship, by serving the needy, sick, and bereaved, providing for the needs of past and present servicemen and women and their dependents. Tours various RSL care facilities in and around Melbourne and Bendigo.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Audio-Visual Aids, University of Melbourne and Returned Sailors, Soldiers and Airmens Imperial League of Australia

results.title: They planted a stone
results.creator_credit: Robin Carruthers, James Carr and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: The story of how the immense desert of the Sudan was transformed, by the harnessing of the waters of the River Nile, into the rich country of the Gezira Cotton Scheme: how this was achieved by means of a partnership with the Sudanese people; and how they have benefited thereby.

results.title: They live again
results.creator_credit: A. Reginald Dobson and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: This film (which is a shortened version of the long film “Accident Service”, 312704) deals with the service provided for injured miners in Great Britain, in a modern hospital and rehabilitation centre in the Midlands. All stages of the treatment of their injuries, and their psyhological rehabiliation are vividly presented.

results.title: They found their place
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film deals with the problems of rehabilitation facing disabled ex-servicemen of World War 2, particularly those who have lost a limb. Something of the vocational guidance and the re-training facilities provided for these men is shown in this film.

results.title: They chose peace
results.brief_description: Documentary account of the International Carnival of Youth for Peace and Friendship held in Sydney in March 1952. The film includes a summary of their support to the carnival and its principles, but it also shows the direct interference from the Menzies Government that attempted to stir popular antipathy and slander.

results.title: They came to Wales
results.creator_credit: Barry Clayton, Edgar H. Anstey, James Ritchie and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: This kaleidoscopic film shows the new industrial Wales of nuclear power and electronics, of jet aircraft and optical glass developing in the older Wales of mountain, seascape and good company. We meet people who came to Wales from abroad and have found a new industrial and social life there.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Clayton, Edgar H. Anstey, James Ritchie and British Transport Films
